Deeper catalogue inspires confidence for Magic Millions Tasmanian Yearling Sale
Bumps in the road are there to make you fly: Tropicus's path to the top is by no means traditional

The best 2-year-olds come from some unusual places in the first Sectionally Speaking back for the year, as form analyst Nic Ashman returns to take stock of last Saturday’s racing. Tropicus and Ninja shone in their barnstorming wins, and it’s inevitable that a Group 1 lies in Sheza Alibi’s future.

Mandy Gunn's Motree Thoroughbreds achieved their biggest yearling sale result to date in 2025 when selling a Harry Angel colt for $300,000 at the Inglis Melbourne Premier Yearling Sale. Gunn ventures across the waters from Tasmania again in 2026 to attempt to repeat the feat.

Fresh off producing a Group 2 winner at the weekend, Newgate Farm's Wild Ruler had two new exciting trial winners on Tuesday at Doomben and Hawkesbury, which the John O'Shea and Tom Charlton sent out a treble of stylish 2-year-olds.

Metrics were up almost entirely across the board for the 2026 renewal of the Magic Millions Tasmanian Yearling Sale, buoyed by the presence of five six-figure lots and both a strong interstate and international buying bench.

Stokes Racing has had a massive week with Stretan Ruler, Rebel Tuesday, and Kazaru all winning stakes races. With all three coming in at good value prices, $220,000, $30,000 and NZ$27,500, affordability is a key factor when it comes to buying yearlings for the stable.

There was a solid morning of trials at Rosehill on Monday, where R. Listed Magic Millions Wyong 2YO Classic winner Paradoxium led up a trio of impressive 2-year-olds from the Bjorn Baker stable, while Hidden Motive cruised to a strong victory ahead of kicking off his autumn.

Ka Ying Rising smashed the course record on his way to 18 successive victories and the Hong Kong-trained record of wins in a row in Sunday’s G1 Queen’s Silver Jubilee Cup. On the 11-race card, Zac Purton won five races and Matthew Poon won three, dominating the jockey’s ranks. Trainer Frankie Lor also celebrated a treble.
The 2026 Magic Millions Tasmanian Yearling Sale takes place on Monday, where vendors are hopeful that the robust selling action that has swept the sales season so far reaches the Apple Isle.
